bibl.title: Letter from [A. Morejos?] to Jefferson Randolph Kean, February 20, 1908

div1.p: [Morejos?] writes about mosquito eradication and other sanitary measures in various Cuban locations.

div1.head: Letter from [A. Morejos?] to Jefferson Randolph Kean, February 20, 1908
div1.opener:
REPUBLICA DE CUBA
??? LA ADMINISTRACION PROVISIONAL DEL GOBIERNO DE LOS E. U.
____
DEPARTAMENTO DE SANIDAD
______
JEFATURA LOCAL DE ALACRANES February 20th, 1.908 ____
Major J. R. Kean.
Adviser to Sanitary Department,
Havana, Cuba.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
Your letter of February 4th has been
received and, carefully considered.

Your remarks on the Cardon's
hedge is exactly true, and respecting the
Pinar de raton it is a bad place, very dan-
gerous in various respects and especially
in the rainy season where mosquitoes
breeds in it, freely.

The banana tree when cut,
leaves a depression near the Jail, and
becomes a deposit of rainy water, per-
manent, making a mosquitoes breeding
place I have made many observations
in this respect, and beg you to acknow-
ledge this information as vendic

The very unfavorable condi-
tion in which I found the hedges,
compelled me to destroy them in-
continently, as they were old, untrim-
med, with a width, varying from three
to five yards and a height more or less
the same. Same as these fences were
2,
REPUBLICA DE CUBA
UN LA ADMINISTRACION PROVISIONAL DEL GOBIERNO DE LOS E. U.
____
DEPARTAMENTO DE SANIDAD
______
JEFATURA LOCAL DE ALACRANES
____
employed as deposits of fecal matters,
[?], and old battles, as you can
easily understand, the Sanitary con-
ditions of Alacranes, Berneja and
Calezes became a serious problem to be
resolved at once, and since then I find
that my works against mosquitoes
destruction results positive, and if my
attention were only enforced on water de-
posits, the work would become practical

My town is situated near the South
Cost, over a swampy land and in
the rainy season recently visited
by the San Andres river. It has always
been a focus of yellow fever, and very
Paludic. I have noticed that since the
mosquitoes have been peresecuted, fever
appears to have disappeared and I am
inclined to believe that Sanitary con-
ditions will be excellent hereafter, although
I desire to have you assist me as heretofore
until Mo of May, then I assume to roll
Alacranes, Berneja's and Calezes, as new
towns, hygienically speaking.

I practice great care in the
vigilance of fevers on non-immunes to
the present I have had no occassion to report one.

REPUBLICA DE CUBA
UN LA ADMINISTRACION PROVISIONAL DEL GOBIERNO DE LOS E. U.
____
DEPARTAMENTO DE SANIDAD
______
JEFATURA LOCAL DE ALACRANES
____

I will soon communicate to you
the answer I am specting from the
Alcalde referal to the Slaughter
house, and also will sumit to your
consideration the house we have ob-
tained from the Municipio for the
lodging of the mules and preservation
of Carts and materials belonging to
this Local Board of Health. In this building
I have the two Pusellones, N. 1. and 2, for
cases in observation. Said building
needs and especially the Mules depart-
ments some light repairs before the
rainy season and as the Municipio
gives it, ad perpetuam, it became a good
property for the Superior Board of Health,
considering that a building like this
would or could not be obtained in
rent for less than 25, or 30, dollars mon-
thly.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully- Dr. A. Morejos
L. S. Officer. JEFATURA LOCAL de SANIDAD
SALUS POPULI
SUPREMA LEX
ALE ANES
